keybindings.toggle-tray: Toggle APE display open or closed
keybindings.toggle-skills-hint: The skill list placement can be selected in the module settings. When using a collapsible list, if the panel is already open, this will toggle skills open and closed and if the tray is not open, it will be opened with skills visible. When the skill list is placed at the bottom, this key will scroll to reveal the skill list.

settings.tray-display-hint: Toggle - only hide APE display when toggled (using hot key) / When token selected - Hide the APE display if no tokens are selected, show otherwise / Automatic - Toggle for players, When token selected for the GM
settings.assume-default-character-hint: When no other token is selected, show the APE display for the user's default character (usually only set for players). This can help with scenes with no tokens (or a generic party token) visible.
settings.use-control-button: Include a toggle button in token controls
settings.show-inspiration-animation-hint: Enables the inspiration animation when an actor has inspiration toggled on. **If you uncheck this box, do not blame me when you forget that you have inspiration. Just saying.**
settings.show-weapon-mastery-hint: Show weapon mastery labels on weapon items in the Equipped section of the APE display.
settings.show-xp-info-hint: Uncheck if you are using milestone leveling. Check to show current and next level XP with XP progress bar and increment/decrement buttons when clicking on the current XP value.
settings.show-no-uses: Show items with no uses left
settings.show-unprepared-cantrips: Show cantrips even if they are not prepared
settings.show-unprepared-spells: Show spells even if they are not prepared
settings.skill-mode-hint: If "Collapsible at the top" is selected, the skill toggle hot key (in control settings) can be used to toggle the skill list open and closed, opening the APE display if needed. If skills are at the bottom of the APE display, the hotkey automatically scrolls to reveal them.
settings.skill-mode-append: At the bottom of the APE display
